summary.name: summary
summary.value: Zend_Form creates wrong regex pattern when using .xml as form configuration

description.name: description
description.value:
Hi,

when you try to use one regex pattern to validate a form element you'll get the following error:
{quote}Exception information:

Message: Internal error matching pattern 'Array' against value 'test'
Stack trace:

#0 /home/test/Zend/Framework/ZendFramework-1.10.0alpha1/library/Zend/Controller/Front.php(946): Zend_Controller_Dispatcher_Standard->dispatch(Object(Zend_Controller_Request_Http), Object(Zend_Controller_Response_Http))
#1 /home/test/Zend/Framework/ZendFramework-1.10.0alpha1/library/Zend/Application/Bootstrap/Bootstrap.php(97): Zend_Controller_Front->dispatch()
#2 /home/test/Zend/Framework/ZendFramework-1.10.0alpha1/library/Zend/Application.php(366): Zend_Application_Bootstrap_Bootstrap->run()
#3 /var/www/test.de/public/index.php(16): Zend_Application->run()
#4 {main}  

Request Parameters:

array (
  'module' => 'default',
  'controller' => 'auth',
  'action' => 'signup',
  'csrf' => '109e6aec85ffbcc4b67d987346c066f5',
  'username' => '',
  'password' => 'test',
  'mail' => '',
  'submit' => 'submit',
) {quote}

system information:
*zf* 1.10.0alpha1
*PHP* PHP 5.2.10-2ubuntu6.3 with Suhosin-Patch 0.9.7

used configuration:
{code:xml}<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<form>
  <user>
    <signup>
      <name>signup</name>
      <class>yela-mod-form</class>
      <method>post</method>
      <action></action>
      
      <elements>
        
        <csrf>
          <type>hash</type>
          <options>
            <salt>unique</salt>
          </options>
        </csrf>
        
        <username>
          <type>text</type>
          <options>
            <label>username:</label>
            <validators>
              <strlen>
                <validator>StringLength</validator>
                <options>
                  <min>4</min>
                  <max>20</max>
                </options>
              </strlen>
            </validators>
            <required>true</required>
          </options>
        </username>
        
        <password>
          <type>password</type>
          <options>
            <label>Password:</label>
            <validators>
              <regex>
                <validator>Regex</validator>
                <options>
                  <pattern>/^[-a-z0-9_]+/i</pattern>
                </options>
              </regex>
              <strlen>
                <validator>StringLength</validator>
                <options>
                  <min>3</min>
                  <max>20</max>
                </options>
              </strlen>
            </validators>
            <required>true</required>
          </options>
        </password>
        
        <mail>
          <type>text</type>
          <options>
            <label>mail</label>
            <validators>
              <email>
                <validator>EmailAddress</validator>
              </email>
            </validators>
            <required>true</required>
          </options>
        </mail>
        
        <submit>
          <type>submit</type>
          <options>
            <value>Submit</value>
          </options>
        </submit>
      </elements>
      
    </signup>
  </user>
</form>{code}

initialize config and create form object:
{code}$formConfig = new Zend_Config_Xml(APPLICATION_PATH . '/resources/forms/signup.xml');
$form = new Zend_Form($formConfig->user->signup);{code}

this would work properly:
$form->getElement('password')->addValidator('Regex', false, array('/^[-a-z0-9_]+/i'));


*edit:*
the regex validator gets an array passed and then it call $this->setPattern($pattern);
in the method it just do: $this->_pattern = (string) $pattern;
so the pattern is "Array"

value.name: Zend_Config
value.description: property based interface to an array

value.body: This works with 1.10.2, Not an Issue any longer.
